questionText: What do you think makes animals different from each other?
How does taxonomy help scientists understand our world? How can we use taxonomy to better understand animals?
If you could create your own animal group, what animals would be in it and why?
What do you think is the biggest difference between wild animals and pets?
How do you think scientists organize animals when they find a new species?
What do you think zoologists do when studying animals in nature?
Why do you think some animals look similar but live in different places?
The more species diversifies, the less likely it is to go extinct. Why is that?
Why do you think some animals have spots, stripes, or bright colors?
What concept did this game demonstrate?
If you could create an animal that could live anywhere, what special traits would it have?
How do you think nature decides which animals will survive and which won’t?
Why do you think some animals live in one place but not in another?
Which is which?
Why are biodiversity and conservation important? Why do distribution patterns vary per region?
Can you think of a place where lots of animals live close together? Why do you think they live there?
What do you think happens when there are too many animals in one area?
Why do some animals live in cold places and others in warm places?
If you could pick a place for a new animal to live, what would it need to survive?
Can you think of a time when you saw an animal doing something interesting? Why do you think it acted that way?
Why do some animals live in groups while others like to be alone?
How do animals show they are happy, scared, or angry?
How do behaviors of an animal link to its ability to survive? How does this affect other animals?
How do baby animals learn how to survive in the wild?
What do you think would happen if animals couldn’t communicate with each other?
Why do some animals change shape or grow new body parts as they get older?
How do animals use their different body parts to find food and stay safe?
Why do some animals have fur, feathers, or scales? How do these help them?
How do animals use their senses, like sight or hearing, to help them survive?
What is the purpose of studying anatomy and the bodily functions of animals?
If you could design a new animal with special abilities, what would it look like?
